DataElement.preferredName: Programmed Cell Death Ligand 1 Tumor Cell Positive Finding Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the percent of PD-L1 (Programmed Cell Death Ligand 1) positive cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Programmed Cell Death 1 Ligand 1 Neoplastic Cell Positive Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (290 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human CD274 gene. This protein is involved in the mediation of both the activation and proliferation of T cells._Cells of, or derived from, a tumor._A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (290 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human CD274 gene. This protein is involved in the mediation of both the activation and proliferation of T cells.

Concepts.definition: Programmed cell death 1 ligand 1 (290 aa, ~33 kDa) is encoded by the human CD274 gene. This protein is involved in the mediation of both the activation and proliferation of T cells.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
